ghostPost.title: T-Shirt Contest: Submissions Closed
ghostPost.excerpt: Time to VOTE for the winner! | Top 10 | Duration: 1 Week
ghostPost.custom_excerpt: Time to VOTE for the winner! | Top 10 | Duration: 1 Week
ghostPost.plaintext:
Time to VOTE for the winner! | Top 10 | Duration: 1 Week

Thank you to everyone who participated in our t-shirt design competition!
We had an amazing turnout from 23 artists. We received 59 t-shirt designs and
now ask for the community to pick the winners.

A collection of submissions can be found in this Imgur album:

Voting Starts Today!
We will have 2 voting periods spanning 2 weeks to bring the 54 designs to the
Top 10 and then the 10 designs to the Top 3.

 * Top 10 voting runs from April 6th to April 12th.
 * Top 3 voting runs from April 13th to April 19th.
 * First, Second and Third place will be announced on our next AMA+FAQ
   livestream April 20th

The first period starts today, you can vote for up to 10 designs. The goal is to
find ourselves a Top 10:

PART T-shirt design contest (pop2) [https://particl.typeform.com/to/WvO1Qj]
Turn data collection into an experience with Typeform. Create beautiful online
forms, surveys, quizzes, and so much… [https://particl.typeform.com/to/WvO1Qj]
particl.typeform.com [https://particl.typeform.com/to/WvO1Qj]

Prizes:
 * 1st Place: $1,000 + winning shirt
 * 2nd Place: $500 + winning shirt
 * 3rd Place: $250 + winning shirt

Note: Monetary rewards will be paid in PART

The contest headquarters is on our Particl Community Github page here:

particlcommunity/pops
[https://github.com/particlcommunity/pops/blob/master/pop-0002.mediawiki]
pops — Particl Opportunity Proposals (POP)
[https://github.com/particlcommunity/pops/blob/master/pop-0002.mediawiki]
github.com
[https://github.com/particlcommunity/pops/blob/master/pop-0002.mediawiki]

Thanks,
Best of luck to all, Have Fun!

Best of luck to all, Have Fun!

prev.excerpt: Final week of voting starts NOW!| Pick Top 3 | Duration: 1 Week
prev.custom_excerpt: Final week of voting starts NOW!| Pick Top 3 | Duration: 1 Week
prev.plaintext:
Final week of voting starts NOW!| Pick Top 3 | Duration: 1 Week

Thank you to everyone who voted in Round 1 of our t-shirt design competition!
The goal of the first round was to pick a Top 10 out of the 59 awesome designs
submitted. Here are the direct voting results:

https://imgur.com/a/Pql4JWe had a fairly decent organic voting turnout — a
little manipulation [speculating ?] — but good participation just the same. A
total of 376 ballots were submitted and all the designs received some votes!

Finalizing Top 10
Since this is the community’s contest we wanted to make sure the Top 10 truly
represented a fun collection of the best designs and equally lets the most
amount of designers into the Top 3 voting round.

After consulting with you guys we all decided to eliminate 5 designs that
received some of the most votes — but would give us trouble with copyright
infringement or print-ability — and included down to the top 15 by votes.

Who’s in?
While all the designs submitted hit the target for creativity and taking a new
spin the Particl brand, these 10 stood above the rest. These are you designs
moving into the next round of voting!

> High Resolution gallary for Top 10 designs: https://imgur.com/a/1q0ZP
Who’s out?
These designs are amazing but are being eliminated because of copyright and/or
print-ability issues. I know we have some t-shirt printing shops in our
community that have the ability to do a wider range of printing than we can for
this contest… I imagine you may see these or more show up in some storefronts on
Particl Marketplace in the future.

Round 2 Voting Starts Today!
You have helped us pick the Top 10 out of 59 amazing designs. Now help us pick
the Top 3.

 * Top 3 voting runs from April 14th to April 20th, 15:00 UTC
 * Particl Team will also vote on their Top 3 and the final winners will be a
   combination of community/team voting results.
 * First, Second and Third place will be announced on our next AMA+FAQ
   livestream April 20th
 * Please only vote once so everyone has a chance to succeed. Thanks :)

Remember, you can vote for up to 3 designs. The goal is to find ourselves a Top
3 and crown the winners!

> VOTE HERE ? https://particl.typeform.com/to/haELX9
Prizes:
 * 1st Place: $1,000 + winning shirt
 * 2nd Place: $500 + winning shirt
 * 3rd Place: $250 + winning shirt

Note: Monetary rewards will be paid in PART

The contest headquarters is on our Particl Community Github page here:

particlcommunity/pops
[https://github.com/particlcommunity/pops/blob/master/pop-0002.mediawiki]
pops — Particl Opportunity Proposals (POP)
[https://github.com/particlcommunity/pops/blob/master/pop-0002.mediawiki]
github.com
[https://github.com/particlcommunity/pops/blob/master/pop-0002.mediawiki]

Thanks,
Congrats to the Top 10 — Best of luck to all of you!

Final week of voting starts NOW!| Pick Top 3 | Duration: 1 Week

Thank you to everyone who voted in Round 1 of our t-shirt design competition!

The goal of the first round was to pick a Top 10 out of the 59 awesome designs submitted. Here are the direct voting results:

We had a fairly decent organic voting turnout — a little manipulation [speculating ?] — but good participation just the same. A total of 376 ballots were submitted and all the designs received some votes!

Finalizing Top 10

Since this is the community’s contest we wanted to make sure the Top 10 truly represented a fun collection of the best designs and equally lets the most amount of designers into the Top 3 voting round.

After consulting with you guys we all decided to eliminate 5 designs that received some of the most votes — but would give us trouble with copyright infringement or print-ability — and included down to the top 15 by votes.

Who’s in?

While all the designs submitted hit the target for creativity and taking a new spin the Particl brand, these 10 stood above the rest. These are you designs moving into the next round of voting!

High Resolution gallary for Top 10 designs: https://imgur.com/a/1q0ZP

Who’s out?

These designs are amazing but are being eliminated because of copyright and/or print-ability issues. I know we have some t-shirt printing shops in our community that have the ability to do a wider range of printing than we can for this contest… I imagine you may see these or more show up in some storefronts on Particl Marketplace in the future.

Round 2 Voting Starts Today!

You have helped us pick the Top 10 out of 59 amazing designs. Now help us pick the Top 3.

  • Top 3 voting runs from April 14th to April 20th, 15:00 UTC
  • Particl Team will also vote on their Top 3 and the final winners will be a combination of community/team voting results.
  • First, Second and Third place will be announced on our next AMA+FAQ livestream April 20th
  • Please only vote once so everyone has a chance to succeed. Thanks :)

Remember, you can vote for up to 3 designs. The goal is to find ourselves a Top 3 and crown the winners!

VOTE HERE ? https://particl.typeform.com/to/haELX9

Prizes:

  • 1st Place: $1,000 + winning shirt
  • 2nd Place: $500 + winning shirt
  • 3rd Place: $250 + winning shirt

Note: Monetary rewards will be paid in PART

The contest headquarters is on our Particl Community Github page here:

particlcommunity/pops
pops — Particl Opportunity Proposals (POP)github.com

Thanks,

Congrats to the Top 10 — Best of luck to all of you!

next.title: Particl Development Roadmap Update

primary_tag.name: Progress
primary_tag.description: Get up to speed with all the most recent Particl developments!

tags.name: Progress
tags.description: Get up to speed with all the most recent Particl developments!

next.plaintext:
Roadmap v2.0
We teased this a bit in our last AMA livestream [https://youtu.be/7DNm9l3GmRs],
and here is a more complete look at what the Particl development team will be
working towards for the upcoming 6 months and beyond. 
https://particl.io/roadmap/

The following items are all in our 2018–2019 pipeline. We’ve identified
important items that are focus features over the next 6 months and beyond but
aren’t tying these to quarters as we did in our Roadmap v1.2
[https://particl.news/project-update-november-8th-2017-c0437292e1f8].

*New items can be added or taken away at anytime, this is a living document.

IN PROGRESS:
With the release
[https://particl.news/release-particl-core-0-16-0-1-1dad242b075] of Particl Core
0.16.0.1 the development team debuts a couple features that they have been
working on.

Support for Hardware Signing Devices
Particl Core 0.16 introduces generic support for Hardware Signing Devices to
provide key-signing capabilities.

Ledger Integration
Initial support for the Ledger Hardware Wallet is here!

This has not yet been extended to blind or anon tranactions and therefore
currently cannot be used exclusively for all functions of the wallet. Support
will continue to be extended in future versions.

Stealth Addresses V2
In order to facilitate deterministic generation of stealth addresses between
Particl Core and Signing Devices the method used to generate these addresses had
to be changed.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Particl Marketplace (MP)
The majority of our team will be focused on the private decentralized
marketplace over the next 6 months. We are readying our Alpha release of the
Particl Marketplace as I write this.

ALPHA is the long-awaited decentralized marketplace dApp within Particl Desktop
[https://particl.io/downloads/]. The Alpha release of the marketplace will be
barebones to start as users begin to test and progress through the
buying/selling process.

As more users onboard we’ll continue refining the user experience and the tools
available to vendors and shoppers.

Listing Governance
Governance won’t be in our initial release of the Markeplace but is one of the
items in the pipeline this year. The vision of the Particl Project is to be a
privacy focused platform for decentralized applications.

The Particl Marketplace is being built to be self-sustaining, self-governing and
completely decentralized. Governance is a huge piece of the puzzle that the team
will be focused on developing to protect privacy and protect users.

Software Development Kit (SDK)
A plan to have a SDK for developers is in the pipeline. The SDK will allow the
creation of applications within the Marketplace or Desktop.

This might not come in 2018 from the Particl team (it is a pipeline item in the
future) but could be a community development item someone takes on as a side
project to create. The full support of the dev team will be available to anyone
wanting to contribute and help speed of delivery of valuable items.

> A software development kit is typically a set of software development tools that
allows the creation of applications for a certain software package, software
framework, hardware platform, computer system, video game console, operating
system, or similar development platform. — Wikipedia
ZMQ for MP Messages
Short for ZeroMQ [http://zguide.zeromq.org/page:all#-MQ-in-a-Hundred-Words],
this is an automated messaging system that allows messages and notifications to
be automatically pushed to Particl Desktop. An example would be if Particl
Desktop has an update available, ZMQ will push notification to Particl Desktop
and users will see a notice a new version of the Desktop is available.

BETA Marketplace
Our next major release of the decentralized marketplace will be BETA.

Beta MP may or may-not be a mainnet viable product. It is too early to tell but
is something the team will be transparent in communicating.

Factors such as Governance and privacy (RingCT) are big factors on whether a
mainnet marketplace is available in the next 6 months on mainnet. 50/50 is the
best bet at the moment; being completely honest and forthcoming.

A Beta marketplace release with governance but without RingCT could happen with
our Confidential TX’s (CT) already providing privacy on mainnet. CT do a good
job of hiding amounts (MAD escrow) but don’t provide complete privacy for
addresses of vendors and buyers in a escrow contract.

Privacy and Governance are 2 of the major factors that ultimately will determine
the BETA marketplace release in the coming 6 months.

Full Particl Marketplace Release
All versions of the MP leading up to full release will be testing versions and
live versions with new features introduced at each release. Once RingCT is on
mainnet, Governance is fully developed, and currency-agnostic options like
cross-chain atomic swaps/integrations have been through the proper testing
environment we’ll plan a Full Particl Marketplace Release.

This will be the truly private decentralized marketplace that will disrupt the
way you buy and sell online.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ring Confidential Transactions (RingCT)
Speaking of privacy and RingCT, we will see some exciting movement on this
privacy enhancement in the next 6 months.

Academic Review
If you aren’t aware, NJIT research Qiang Tang [https://web.njit.edu/~qiang/] is
leading a group in a review of our RingCT privacy on Particl Testnet. Particl
Foundation created a grant with the university in Sept. 2017 for this research,
Qiang’s lab received the grant money in Nov. 2017
[https://web.njit.edu/~qiang/#activities] and began working on a 6 month review
in Dec. 2017.

They are 3 months into review and will provide the foundation with a report
after 6 months on the privacy, cryptography and security recommendations for
Particl’s RingCT implementation on the latest Bitcoin codebase.

Bulletproofs: Short Proofs for Confidential Transactions
A very exciting paper [https://eprint.iacr.org/2017/1066.pdf] was released in
the middle of our grant with Qiang (NJIT) that significantly reduces the burden
of confidential transactions on the blockchain.

> Bulletproofs greatly improve on the linear (in n) sized range proofs in existing
proposals for confidential transactions in Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.
Particl is the only Bitcoin-based cryptocurrency with Confidential Transactions
live and available today. We don’t allow CT to be default because of the
size/cost this privacy introduces to transactions. Here is an infographic you
may have seen showing the size/cost of each level of privacy for PART.

You can see that transaction size of CT and RingCT are 20x that of the
pseudo-anonymous “public” state most users default to.

Bulletproofs is a big development that we will be reviewing this year. We
estimate research, development, implementation and testing will be a 3–4 month
part-time assignment for Tecnovert, Particl Lead Core Developer.

RingCT — Mainnet
It is fair to give a realistic checklist of the steps needed to see RingCT on
Particl Mainnet in the coming months. Some work has begun, some work will need
to be adjusted and some work has yet to begin.

*Future dates are estimates and subject to change.

 * June 2017
   [https://particl.news/particl-dev-update-june-1st-2017-f736948a338d]— Particl
   is the first Bitcoin-based cryptocurrency with CT and RingCT on pre-launch
   testnets
 * July 2017
   [https://particl.news/particl-launch-update-july-17th-2017-15ec6d4fd6a8]
   — Particl launches as first project with privacy available through
   Confidential Transactions on mainnet. RingCT continues on new versions of
   testnet
 * September 2017— Particl Foundation creates a research grant with the New
   Jersey Institute of Technology to review our RingCT implementation on Bitcoin
   codebase.
 * November 2017— Qiang Tang’s research lab receives the Particl Foundation
   grant
 * December 2017— Research begins on Particl RingCT
 * *est. April 2018 — Particl begins developing Bulletproofs on testnet. Working
   versions will be relayed to NJIT to bootstrap onto their ongoing research
   efforts.
 * *est. June 2018 — NJIT researchers present Particl Foundation with their
   review and recommendation of our RingCT / CT / Bulletproofs development on
   Bitcoin codebase.
 * *est. July 2018 — Particl development will modify/improve CT/RingCT code
   based on NJIT recommendations. First Bulletproofs on Testnet
 * *est. August 2018 — Particl Foundation will have improved code reviewed (1
   month peer review, 3rd party)
 * *est. September 2018 — Particl development will make any changes necessary.
   New code will be on Testnet. Hardfork announced for RingCT to be moved to
   Mainnet
 * *est. October 2018 — Hardfork completed, RingCT on Mainnet alongside
   Bulletproofs CT


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PIPELINE:
Copay Cold Staking
Particl Copay is a secure wallet made for desktop and mobile OS. We plan to
integrate Particl Cold Staking into this multi-signature wallet.

Community Fund Vote
There is PART remaining from the Community Initiative Fund #1
[https://particl.news/a-community-driven-initiative-e26724100c3a]— roughly
30,000 PART (at this time) with a few more claims still being vetted. The
community needs to create a plan for these extra coins that were donated but not
needed. Start brainstorming!

Lightning Network
A lot of excitement is stirring in the space because of lightning (LND)
releasing on mainnet. Obviously, this is a big item on our radar as we build
paths for other cryptocurrency coins to be used on Particl Marketplace.

#BlindLightning | #BlackLightning
What if Particl Confidential TXs or even RingCT could be leveraged in atomic
swaps/ lightning network transactions between PART and other coins — providing
true privacy for non-private coins?


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Particl Desktop — future versions
In our last AMAFAQ livestream we also mentioned the current status of our
flagship app, Particl Desktop.

New features related to the Particl Marketplace integration into Desktop will be
ongoing throughout 2018. We’ve had a lot of requests for extra widgets and
features from the community/team that are moving down the pipeline.

Below we’ve begun a checklist of requested features.

 * Multiwallet modal
 * Coin Control
 * Alias Addresses
 * Balances and Staking graphs
 * Remote Daemon Connection
 * Tor Integration
 * Settings modal
 * Modal Refactoring

Particl Marketplace is the main focus of the team moving forward, but you can
expect to see some of these features coming into Desktop as well. The
marketplace is priority number one.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We’re excited to see the impact Particl Marketplace and PART have in our space
for 2018–2019. We all see an opportunity to provide use cases for other coins
with our privacy focused decentralized applications — starting with the
Marketplace.

Join us in our Riot/Telegram channels to get involved:

Riot [https://riot.im/app/#/room/#particl:matrix.org] | Telegram
[https://t.me/particlproject] | Discord [https://discordapp.com/invite/2tVJaZ9]

Thank You
Particl Team

This might not come in 2018 from the Particl team (it is a pipeline item in the future) but could be a community development item someone takes on as a side project to create. The full support of the dev team will be available to anyone wanting to contribute and help speed of delivery of valuable items.

A software development kit is typically a set of software development tools that allows the creation of applications for a certain software package, software framework, hardware platform, computer system, video game console, operating system, or similar development platform. — Wikipedia

ZMQ for MP Messages

Short for ZeroMQ, this is an automated messaging system that allows messages and notifications to be automatically pushed to Particl Desktop. An example would be if Particl Desktop has an update available, ZMQ will push notification to Particl Desktop and users will see a notice a new version of the Desktop is available.

BETA Marketplace

Our next major release of the decentralized marketplace will be BETA.

Beta MP may or may-not be a mainnet viable product. It is too early to tell but is something the team will be transparent in communicating.

Factors such as Governance and privacy (RingCT) are big factors on whether a mainnet marketplace is available in the next 6 months on mainnet. 50/50 is the best bet at the moment; being completely honest and forthcoming.

A Beta marketplace release with governance but without RingCT could happen with our Confidential TX’s (CT) already providing privacy on mainnet. CT do a good job of hiding amounts (MAD escrow) but don’t provide complete privacy for addresses of vendors and buyers in a escrow contract.

Privacy and Governance are 2 of the major factors that ultimately will determine the BETA marketplace release in the coming 6 months.

Full Particl Marketplace Release

All versions of the MP leading up to full release will be testing versions and live versions with new features introduced at each release. Once RingCT is on mainnet, Governance is fully developed, and currency-agnostic options like cross-chain atomic swaps/integrations have been through the proper testing environment we’ll plan a Full Particl Marketplace Release.

This will be the truly private decentralized marketplace that will disrupt the way you buy and sell online.

Ring Confidential Transactions (RingCT)

Speaking of privacy and RingCT, we will see some exciting movement on this privacy enhancement in the next 6 months.

Academic Review

If you aren’t aware, NJIT research Qiang Tang is leading a group in a review of our RingCT privacy on Particl Testnet. Particl Foundation created a grant with the university in Sept. 2017 for this research, Qiang’s lab received the grant money in Nov. 2017 and began working on a 6 month review in Dec. 2017.

They are 3 months into review and will provide the foundation with a report after 6 months on the privacy, cryptography and security recommendations for Particl’s RingCT implementation on the latest Bitcoin codebase.

Bulletproofs: Short Proofs for Confidential Transactions

A very exciting paper was released in the middle of our grant with Qiang (NJIT) that significantly reduces the burden of confidential transactions on the blockchain.

Bulletproofs greatly improve on the linear (in n) sized range proofs in existing proposals for confidential transactions in Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.

Particl is the only Bitcoin-based cryptocurrency with Confidential Transactions live and available today. We don’t allow CT to be default because of the size/cost this privacy introduces to transactions. Here is an infographic you may have seen showing the size/cost of each level of privacy for PART.

You can see that transaction size of CT and RingCT are 20x that of the pseudo-anonymous “public” state most users default to.

Bulletproofs is a big development that we will be reviewing this year. We estimate research, development, implementation and testing will be a 3–4 month part-time assignment for Tecnovert, Particl Lead Core Developer.

RingCT — Mainnet

It is fair to give a realistic checklist of the steps needed to see RingCT on Particl Mainnet in the coming months. Some work has begun, some work will need to be adjusted and some work has yet to begin.

*Future dates are estimates and subject to change.

  • June 2017 — Particl is the first Bitcoin-based cryptocurrency with CT and RingCT on pre-launch testnets
  • July 2017 — Particl launches as first project with privacy available through Confidential Transactions on mainnet. RingCT continues on new versions of testnet
  • September 2017 — Particl Foundation creates a research grant with the New Jersey Institute of Technology to review our RingCT implementation on Bitcoin codebase.
  • November 2017 — Qiang Tang’s research lab receives the Particl Foundation grant
  • December 2017 — Research begins on Particl RingCT
  • *est. April 2018 — Particl begins developing Bulletproofs on testnet. Working versions will be relayed to NJIT to bootstrap onto their ongoing research efforts.
  • *est. June 2018 — NJIT researchers present Particl Foundation with their review and recommendation of our RingCT / CT / Bulletproofs development on Bitcoin codebase.
  • *est. July 2018 — Particl development will modify/improve CT/RingCT code based on NJIT recommendations. First Bulletproofs on Testnet
  • *est. August 2018 — Particl Foundation will have improved code reviewed (1 month peer review, 3rd party)
  • *est. September 2018 — Particl development will make any changes necessary. New code will be on Testnet. Hardfork announced for RingCT to be moved to Mainnet
  • *est. October 2018 — Hardfork completed, RingCT on Mainnet alongside Bulletproofs CT

PIPELINE:

Copay Cold Staking

Particl Copay is a secure wallet made for desktop and mobile OS. We plan to integrate Particl Cold Staking into this multi-signature wallet.

Community Fund Vote

There is PART remaining from the Community Initiative Fund #1 — roughly 30,000 PART (at this time) with a few more claims still being vetted. The community needs to create a plan for these extra coins that were donated but not needed. Start brainstorming!

Lightning Network

A lot of excitement is stirring in the space because of lightning (LND) releasing on mainnet. Obviously, this is a big item on our radar as we build paths for other cryptocurrency coins to be used on Particl Marketplace.

#BlindLightning | #BlackLightning

What if Particl Confidential TXs or even RingCT could be leveraged in atomic swaps/ lightning network transactions between PART and other coins — providing true privacy for non-private coins?

Particl Desktop — future versions

In our last AMAFAQ livestream we also mentioned the current status of our flagship app, Particl Desktop.

New features related to the Particl Marketplace integration into Desktop will be ongoing throughout 2018. We’ve had a lot of requests for extra widgets and features from the community/team that are moving down the pipeline.

Below we’ve begun a checklist of requested features.

  • Multiwallet modal
  • Coin Control
  • Alias Addresses
  • Balances and Staking graphs
  • Remote Daemon Connection
  • Tor Integration
  • Settings modal
  • Modal Refactoring

Particl Marketplace is the main focus of the team moving forward, but you can expect to see some of these features coming into Desktop as well. The marketplace is priority number one.

We’re excited to see the impact Particl Marketplace and PART have in our space for 2018–2019. We all see an opportunity to provide use cases for other coins with our privacy focused decentralized applications — starting with the Marketplace.

Join us in our Riot/Telegram channels to get involved:

Riot | Telegram | Discord

Thank You

Particl Team

childHtmlRehype.html:
Roadmap v2.0

We teased this a bit in our last AMA livestream, and here is a more complete look at what the Particl development team will be working towards for the upcoming 6 months and beyond. https://particl.io/roadmap/

The following items are all in our 2018–2019 pipeline. We’ve identified important items that are focus features over the next 6 months and beyond but aren’t tying these to quarters as we did in our Roadmap v1.2.

*New items can be added or taken away at anytime, this is a living document.

IN PROGRESS:

With the release of Particl Core 0.16.0.1 the development team debuts a couple features that they have been working on.

Support for Hardware Signing Devices

Particl Core 0.16 introduces generic support for Hardware Signing Devices to provide key-signing capabilities.

Ledger Integration

Initial support for the Ledger Hardware Wallet is here!

This has not yet been extended to blind or anon tranactions and therefore currently cannot be used exclusively for all functions of the wallet. Support will continue to be extended in future versions.

Stealth Addresses V2

In order to facilitate deterministic generation of stealth addresses between Particl Core and Signing Devices the method used to generate these addresses had to be changed.

Particl Marketplace (MP)

The majority of our team will be focused on the private decentralized marketplace over the next 6 months. We are readying our Alpha release of the Particl Marketplace as I write this.

ALPHA is the long-awaited decentralized marketplace dApp within Particl Desktop. The Alpha release of the marketplace will be barebones to start as users begin to test and progress through the buying/selling process.

As more users onboard we’ll continue refining the user experience and the tools available to vendors and shoppers.

Listing Governance

Governance won’t be in our initial release of the Markeplace but is one of the items in the pipeline this year. The vision of the Particl Project is to be a privacy focused platform for decentralized applications.

The Particl Marketplace is being built to be self-sustaining, self-governing and completely decentralized. Governance is a huge piece of the puzzle that the team will be focused on developing to protect privacy and protect users.

Software Development Kit (SDK)

A plan to have a SDK for developers is in the pipeline. The SDK will allow the creation of applications within the Marketplace or Desktop.

This might not come in 2018 from the Particl team (it is a pipeline item in the future) but could be a community development item someone takes on as a side project to create. The full support of the dev team will be available to anyone wanting to contribute and help speed of delivery of valuable items.

A software development kit is typically a set of software development tools that allows the creation of applications for a certain software package, software framework, hardware platform, computer system, video game console, operating system, or similar development platform. — Wikipedia

ZMQ for MP Messages

Short for ZeroMQ, this is an automated messaging system that allows messages and notifications to be automatically pushed to Particl Desktop. An example would be if Particl Desktop has an update available, ZMQ will push notification to Particl Desktop and users will see a notice a new version of the Desktop is available.

BETA Marketplace

Our next major release of the decentralized marketplace will be BETA.

Beta MP may or may-not be a mainnet viable product. It is too early to tell but is something the team will be transparent in communicating.

Factors such as Governance and privacy (RingCT) are big factors on whether a mainnet marketplace is available in the next 6 months on mainnet. 50/50 is the best bet at the moment; being completely honest and forthcoming.

A Beta marketplace release with governance but without RingCT could happen with our Confidential TX’s (CT) already providing privacy on mainnet. CT do a good job of hiding amounts (MAD escrow) but don’t provide complete privacy for addresses of vendors and buyers in a escrow contract.

Privacy and Governance are 2 of the major factors that ultimately will determine the BETA marketplace release in the coming 6 months.

Full Particl Marketplace Release

All versions of the MP leading up to full release will be testing versions and live versions with new features introduced at each release. Once RingCT is on mainnet, Governance is fully developed, and currency-agnostic options like cross-chain atomic swaps/integrations have been through the proper testing environment we’ll plan a Full Particl Marketplace Release.

This will be the truly private decentralized marketplace that will disrupt the way you buy and sell online.

Ring Confidential Transactions (RingCT)

Speaking of privacy and RingCT, we will see some exciting movement on this privacy enhancement in the next 6 months.

Academic Review

If you aren’t aware, NJIT research Qiang Tang is leading a group in a review of our RingCT privacy on Particl Testnet. Particl Foundation created a grant with the university in Sept. 2017 for this research, Qiang’s lab received the grant money in Nov. 2017 and began working on a 6 month review in Dec. 2017.

They are 3 months into review and will provide the foundation with a report after 6 months on the privacy, cryptography and security recommendations for Particl’s RingCT implementation on the latest Bitcoin codebase.

Bulletproofs: Short Proofs for Confidential Transactions

A very exciting paper was released in the middle of our grant with Qiang (NJIT) that significantly reduces the burden of confidential transactions on the blockchain.

Bulletproofs greatly improve on the linear (in n) sized range proofs in existing proposals for confidential transactions in Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.

Particl is the only Bitcoin-based cryptocurrency with Confidential Transactions live and available today. We don’t allow CT to be default because of the size/cost this privacy introduces to transactions. Here is an infographic you may have seen showing the size/cost of each level of privacy for PART.

You can see that transaction size of CT and RingCT are 20x that of the pseudo-anonymous “public” state most users default to.

Bulletproofs is a big development that we will be reviewing this year. We estimate research, development, implementation and testing will be a 3–4 month part-time assignment for Tecnovert, Particl Lead Core Developer.

RingCT — Mainnet

It is fair to give a realistic checklist of the steps needed to see RingCT on Particl Mainnet in the coming months. Some work has begun, some work will need to be adjusted and some work has yet to begin.

*Future dates are estimates and subject to change.

  • June 2017 — Particl is the first Bitcoin-based cryptocurrency with CT and RingCT on pre-launch testnets
  • July 2017 — Particl launches as first project with privacy available through Confidential Transactions on mainnet. RingCT continues on new versions of testnet
  • September 2017 — Particl Foundation creates a research grant with the New Jersey Institute of Technology to review our RingCT implementation on Bitcoin codebase.
  • November 2017 — Qiang Tang’s research lab receives the Particl Foundation grant
  • December 2017 — Research begins on Particl RingCT
  • *est. April 2018 — Particl begins developing Bulletproofs on testnet. Working versions will be relayed to NJIT to bootstrap onto their ongoing research efforts.
  • *est. June 2018 — NJIT researchers present Particl Foundation with their review and recommendation of our RingCT / CT / Bulletproofs development on Bitcoin codebase.
  • *est. July 2018 — Particl development will modify/improve CT/RingCT code based on NJIT recommendations. First Bulletproofs on Testnet
  • *est. August 2018 — Particl Foundation will have improved code reviewed (1 month peer review, 3rd party)
  • *est. September 2018 — Particl development will make any changes necessary. New code will be on Testnet. Hardfork announced for RingCT to be moved to Mainnet
  • *est. October 2018 — Hardfork completed, RingCT on Mainnet alongside Bulletproofs CT

PIPELINE:

Copay Cold Staking

Particl Copay is a secure wallet made for desktop and mobile OS. We plan to integrate Particl Cold Staking into this multi-signature wallet.

Community Fund Vote

There is PART remaining from the Community Initiative Fund #1 — roughly 30,000 PART (at this time) with a few more claims still being vetted. The community needs to create a plan for these extra coins that were donated but not needed. Start brainstorming!

Lightning Network

A lot of excitement is stirring in the space because of lightning (LND) releasing on mainnet. Obviously, this is a big item on our radar as we build paths for other cryptocurrency coins to be used on Particl Marketplace.

#BlindLightning | #BlackLightning

What if Particl Confidential TXs or even RingCT could be leveraged in atomic swaps/ lightning network transactions between PART and other coins — providing true privacy for non-private coins?

Particl Desktop — future versions

In our last AMAFAQ livestream we also mentioned the current status of our flagship app, Particl Desktop.

New features related to the Particl Marketplace integration into Desktop will be ongoing throughout 2018. We’ve had a lot of requests for extra widgets and features from the community/team that are moving down the pipeline.

Below we’ve begun a checklist of requested features.

  • Multiwallet modal
  • Coin Control
  • Alias Addresses
  • Balances and Staking graphs
  • Remote Daemon Connection
  • Tor Integration
  • Settings modal
  • Modal Refactoring

Particl Marketplace is the main focus of the team moving forward, but you can expect to see some of these features coming into Desktop as well. The marketplace is priority number one.

We’re excited to see the impact Particl Marketplace and PART have in our space for 2018–2019. We all see an opportunity to provide use cases for other coins with our privacy focused decentralized applications — starting with the Marketplace.

Join us in our Riot/Telegram channels to get involved:

Riot | Telegram | Discord

Thank You

Particl Team

items.heading: Bulletproofs: Short Proofs for Confidential Transactions
